back_cards.definition_en: to take for granted without proof
back_cards.example_en: I assume it will rain this afternoon based on the clouds.

back_cards.definition_en: to take on a role or responsibility
back_cards.example_en: She assumed the role of team leader during the project.
He assumed everyone agreed with his plan.
The company assumed ownership of the small startup.

back_cards.definition_en: to adopt a particular attitude or manner
back_cards.example_en: He assumed a confident tone during the presentation.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who creates written content
back_cards.example_en: The writer published a new novel last month.

back_cards.definition_en: someone who composes articles for a newspaper
back_cards.example_en: She works as a writer for the local news outlet.

back_cards.definition_en: an author of scripts for movies or TV
back_cards.example_en: The writer crafted a thrilling screenplay for the film.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who writes in a specific genre
back_cards.example_en: He is a science fiction writer with a loyal fan base.

back_cards.definition_en: someone who keeps a journal or blog
back_cards.example_en: As a travel writer, she shares her adventures online.

back_cards.definition_en: to carry out an action or task
back_cards.example_en: The surgeon will perform the operation tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: to act or sing in front of an audience
back_cards.example_en: She will perform a song at the school talent show.

back_cards.definition_en: to function or operate in a certain way
back_cards.example_en: This car performs well on mountain roads.

back_cards.definition_en: to fulfill a duty or role
back_cards.example_en: He performs his job with great dedication.
The team performed a safety drill at the factory.
She received credit for her innovative design.
He used his credit card to buy a new laptop.
She needs three more credits to graduate.

back_cards.definition_en: trust in someone’s ability to pay
back_cards.example_en: The store offered credit to loyal customers.

back_cards.definition_en: acknowledgment in a publication or film
back_cards.example_en: His name appeared in the movie credits.

back_cards.definition_en: having the color of grass or lime
back_cards.example_en: The green leaves glowed in the sunlight.
They built a green office with solar panels.
The green intern learned quickly on the job.
The green bananas will ripen in a few days.
Her green dress stood out at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: a legal union between two people
back_cards.example_en: Their marriage was celebrated with a big wedding.
The merger was a marriage of two tech companies.
Marriage requires trust and communication.
They invited 200 guests to their marriage.
Their marriage has lasted over 20 years.
The patient recovered after a heart operation.
The rescue operation saved many lives.
She oversees the operation of the factory.
The operation was launched at dawn.
The company streamlined its operation for efficiency.
It was, indeed, a beautiful sunset.
He is indeed the best candidate for the job.
‘It’s cold today.’ ‘Indeed, it is!’
She’s talented and, indeed, very hardworking.
You finished the project already? Indeed!

back_cards.definition_en: to rest with eyes closed and body inactive
back_cards.example_en: I sleep for eight hours every night.

back_cards.definition_en: to be in a state of rest
back_cards.example_en: The baby sleeps peacefully in the crib.
We’ll sleep at a hotel during the trip.
Don’t sleep on this great opportunity!
This tent sleeps four people comfortably.
Water is necessary for survival.
A visa is necessary to enter that country.
Change is necessary for progress.
It’s necessary to wear a helmet while biking.
Her skills were necessary for the project’s success.
She revealed her secret to her best friend.
The curtain revealed a stunning stage design.
The report revealed new environmental concerns.
The detective revealed the truth about the case.

back_cards.definition_en: to display a quality or feature
back_cards.example_en: His actions revealed his true character.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who represents someone else
back_cards.example_en: The actor hired an agent to negotiate contracts.

back_cards.definition_en: a person acting secretly for an organization
back_cards.example_en: The agent gathered intelligence for the agency.
This cleaning agent removes tough stains.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who facilitates a process
back_cards.example_en: The travel agent booked our vacation.
She was an agent of change in her community.

back_cards.definition_en: the ability to enter a place
back_cards.example_en: Only members have access to the club.
She gained access to the company’s database.

back_cards.definition_en: a way to approach or enter
back_cards.example_en: The back door provides access to the garden.
Access to education is a basic right.

back_cards.definition_en: a means to connect to a system
back_cards.example_en: Wi-Fi access is free at the café.
We met at a bar after work.
The gym has a bar for weightlifting.

back_cards.definition_en: a counter for serving food or drinks
back_cards.example_en: She sat at the bar and ordered a coffee.
The fallen tree was a bar to the path.
He set a high bar for the team’s performance.
The candidates held a debate on TV.
We had a debate about the best movie.
The team’s debate led to a better plan.
She joined the debate club to improve her skills.
The town hall hosted a debate on local issues.
He injured his leg while running.
The first leg of the trip was by train.
The table’s leg was wobbly.
They won the first leg of the race.
She cooked a leg of lamb for dinner.
This jar contains homemade jam.

back_cards.definition_en: to include or have as a part
back_cards.example_en: The book contains many useful tips.
She tried to contain her laughter during the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: to limit the spread of something
back_cards.example_en: Firefighters worked to contain the wildfire.
The recipe contains sugar and flour.
He beat the drum with a steady rhythm.
Our team beat the rivals in the final match.
She beat the eggs for the cake batter.

back_cards.definition_en: to move rhythmically, like a heart
back_cards.example_en: Her heart beat faster during the speech.
They beat the odds to finish the project.
The cool breeze felt nice on a hot day.
His new jacket is really cool.
She stayed cool during the stressful meeting.
That concert was so cool last night!
Store the milk in a cool place.

back_cards.definition_en: relating to a system of government by the people
back_cards.example_en: The country held democratic elections.
The club has a democratic decision-making process.
Freedom of speech is a democratic principle.
The meeting was democratic, allowing everyone to speak.
She is a strong advocate for democratic reforms.
The cold wind made me shiver.
His cold response surprised everyone.
She stayed home with a cold.
The movie’s ending felt cold and abrupt.
I went into the quiz cold and still passed.

back_cards.definition_en: a transparent material for windows or containers
back_cards.example_en: The glass in the window broke during the storm.
She poured water into a glass.
He checked his reflection in the glass.
The telescope’s glass was perfectly polished.

back_cards.definition_en: a quantity held by a glass
back_cards.example_en: He drank a glass of juice with breakfast.
She worked hard to improve her grades.
He practiced daily to improve his piano playing.
The company improved its website design.
Her health began to improve after treatment.

back_cards.definition_en: to increase in quality or value
back_cards.example_en: The weather will improve by the weekend.
The movie is rated for adults only.
As an adult, she makes her own decisions.
Adults can vote in the election.

back_cards.definition_en: a grown-up in a social context
back_cards.example_en: The party was for adults, not children.
He acted like an adult during the crisis.

back_cards.definition_en: the exchange of goods or services
back_cards.example_en: International trade boosts the economy.
He learned the trade of carpentry.
She works in the fashion trade.
We made a trade: my book for his game.
The trade in spices was profitable.
The religious ceremony was held at the temple.
She is deeply religious and prays daily.
The school teaches religious studies.
He has a religious dedication to his work.
The festival is a religious event for the community.

back_cards.definition_en: the upper part of the body
back_cards.example_en: She wore a hat on her head.
He is the head of the department.
The head of the table was reserved for guests.
The farm has 50 head of cattle.
She has a good head for numbers.
The movie received a positive review.
The company conducted a review of its policies.

back_cards.definition_en: a summary or study of material
back_cards.example_en: She wrote a review of the book for class.

back_cards.definition_en: an inspection of work or progress
back_cards.example_en: The manager scheduled a performance review.
His review of the restaurant was harsh.
What kind of music do you like?
This kind of fish lives in deep water.
They sell all kinds of fruits at the market.
This kind of problem needs a quick fix.
That kind of behavior is unacceptable.

back_cards.definition_en: a place where someone lives or works
back_cards.example_en: She wrote her address on the envelope.
The president gave an address on TV.

back_cards.definition_en: a way to contact someone electronically
back_cards.example_en: Please send the file to my email address.
The store’s address is 123 Main Street.

back_cards.definition_en: a manner of speaking to someone
back_cards.example_en: His address to the team was inspiring.

back_cards.definition_en: an organization of people with a common goal
back_cards.example_en: She joined the teachers’ association.
There’s an association between diet and health.

back_cards.definition_en: a group formed for a purpose
back_cards.example_en: The association hosts charity events yearly.
The word ‘blue’ has an association with calmness.
The association with the brand boosted sales.

back_cards.definition_en: a standard unit of size or quantity
back_cards.example_en: A liter is a measure of volume.

back_cards.definition_en: an action taken to achieve a goal
back_cards.example_en: The government introduced new safety measures.
Her success was a measure of her hard work.
He used a tape measure to check the length.
The song has a fast measure.
The store has a large stock of books.
She invested in tech stock last year.
The soup was made with chicken stock.
The farmer keeps stock like cows and pigs.
He comes from sturdy pioneer stock.
I need to fill the car with gas.

back_cards.definition_en: a substance in a gaseous state
back_cards.example_en: Carbon dioxide is a common gas.
The stove runs on natural gas.
That party was a total gas!
The soldiers were exposed to toxic gas.
The lake is very deep in the center.
They had a deep conversation about life.
The book explores deep philosophical ideas.
She was deep in thought during the meeting.
His voice has a deep, soothing tone.
The lawyer defended her client in court.
We consulted a lawyer about the contract.

back_cards.definition_en: a professional in a legal case
back_cards.example_en: The lawyer prepared evidence for the trial.
Her lawyer negotiated a fair settlement.

back_cards.definition_en: a specialist in a field of law
back_cards.example_en: He is a tax lawyer with years of experience.
The factory increased production of cars.
The school put on a production of Hamlet.
The production of clean energy is vital.
Crop production was high this year.
Her production of evidence changed the case.
I can relate your story to my own experience.
She can relate to the struggles of students.
He related the events of the trip to his friends.
This rule relates to workplace safety.
The study relates climate to crop growth.
The book fell open to the middle.
We found a middle ground in the argument.
He felt a pain in his middle after eating.
The project is in the middle of development.
The store is in the middle of town.

back_cards.definition_en: the act of controlling or organizing
back_cards.example_en: Good management improved team performance.

back_cards.definition_en: a group of people in charge
back_cards.example_en: The management approved the new budget.
Time management is key to success.
She studied management in college.
His management of the crisis was impressive.
Her original idea won the competition.
The original plan was to meet at noon.
His artwork is highly original.
This is an original painting, not a print.
The original version of the song was slower.

back_cards.definition_en: a person harmed by a crime
back_cards.example_en: The victim reported the theft to the police.
The flood left many victims homeless.

back_cards.definition_en: a person suffering from an event
back_cards.example_en: He was a victim of bad luck.
She felt like a victim of office gossip.
The victim of the accident was recovering.

back_cards.definition_en: a disease caused by abnormal cell growth
back_cards.example_en: She is undergoing treatment for breast cancer.
Corruption is a cancer in the system.
Early detection can help fight cancer.
Her birthday falls under the Cancer sign.
Poverty is a cancer affecting many communities.

back_cards.definition_en: a formal talk to an audience
back_cards.example_en: The president gave a speech on TV.
His speech improved after therapy.
Her speech was clear and confident.
Free speech is a democratic right.
The play’s speech was poetic and moving.
She has a particular interest in history.
This wine has a particular flavor.
He paid particular attention to the details.
She’s very particular about her coffee.
That particular book is my favorite.
The trial lasted for three weeks.
The drug is in clinical trials.
Her first trial at baking was a success.
Moving abroad was a trial for her.
The team held trials for new players.
None of the cookies were left.
None of my friends could come to the party.
None of the answers were correct.
We have none left in stock.
None of this concerns me.
She added one item to her shopping list.

back_cards.definition_en: a piece of news or information
back_cards.example_en: The newspaper published an item about the event.
This item is on sale today.
The agenda’s first item was budget approval.
The museum displayed a rare item.
The weight of the box was 10 pounds.
Her opinion carries a lot of weight.
The recipe calls for 200 grams by weight.
The weight of responsibility was heavy.
He lifted weights at the gym.
We’ll meet tomorrow at noon.
Tomorrow’s technology will be amazing.
The package arrives tomorrow morning.
She’s planning for tomorrow’s challenges.
Tomorrow is my big presentation.
She took a step toward the door.
The first step is to gather materials.
He climbed the steps to the stage.
The shop is just a step away.
Joining the club was a step forward.
She has a positive attitude about work.
We received positive confirmation of the order.
The test results were positive for recovery.
His feedback was positive and helpful.
The response to the plan was positive.
Please complete the application form.

back_cards.definition_en: the shape or structure of something
back_cards.example_en: The sculpture has an unusual form.
This is a new form of energy.
The essay follows a standard form.
She’s in top form for the race.

back_cards.definition_en: a legal member of a country
back_cards.example_en: She became a citizen after years of residency.

back_cards.definition_en: a resident of a city or town
back_cards.example_en: The citizens voted for a new mayor.
Every citizen can vote at 18.
He’s a citizen who volunteers often.
Citizens gathered to discuss local issues.

back_cards.definition_en: the act of learning or researching
back_cards.example_en: Her study of biology led to a discovery.
The study showed new health trends.

back_cards.definition_en: a room for reading or working
back_cards.example_en: He works in his study every evening.
She published a study on climate change.
His study of the painting revealed details.
We planned a trip to the mountains.
She took a trip to the grocery store.
Their trip to Europe was unforgettable.
He avoided a trip on the uneven path.
The camping trip was full of fun.
They plan to establish a new business.
The evidence helped establish his innocence.
She established a charity for animals.
They established a routine for the kids.
He established himself as a top chef.
The executive made key company decisions.

back_cards.definition_en: a person in charge of operations
back_cards.example_en: She’s the executive of the marketing team.
The executive met with the board.
The executive approved the new project.
He was promoted to chief executive.
She studies politics at the university.
Office politics can be challenging.
His politics lean toward reform.
Politics shapes our daily lives.
The politics of healthcare are complex.
He picked up a stick from the ground.

back_cards.definition_en: a tool for support or play
back_cards.example_en: She uses a stick to play hockey.
I ate a stick of celery for a snack.
He’s a stick in the mud about new ideas.
They live out in the sticks.
The customer purchased a new phone.
She’s a regular customer at the salon.
The store values every customer.
The customer asked for a refund.
Customers gave positive feedback online.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who oversees a team
back_cards.example_en: The manager led the project meeting.
She’s the manager of the restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: a person handling finances or tasks
back_cards.example_en: The manager approved the budget.

back_cards.definition_en: a coach of a sports team
back_cards.example_en: The soccer manager trained the players.
The event manager planned the festival.
The movie was rather boring.
I’d rather stay home than go out.
It’s a small house, or rather, an apartment.
The hike was rather challenging but fun.
She’d rather read than watch TV.

back_cards.definition_en: to release a book or article
back_cards.example_en: The author will publish a new novel.
The newspaper published the story.
They publish educational materials.
She published her study in a journal.
The company publishes music and videos.
The song is popular on the radio.
This app is popular among students.
The café serves popular dishes.
Those shoes are popular this season.
The movie has a popular storyline.

back_cards.definition_en: to produce musical sounds with the voice
back_cards.example_en: She loves to sing in the choir.
He will sing at the concert tonight.
The kettle began to sing on the stove.
Her heart seemed to sing with happiness.
The poet would sing his verses aloud.
She walked ahead of the group.
We have a busy week ahead.
Our team is ahead by two points.
The project finished ahead of schedule.
Move ahead with your plans.
The company hosted a conference for employees.
She spoke at a science conference.
The team held a conference to plan.
The conference championship is next week.
The tech conference attracted thousands.
The total for the groceries was $50.
The total of the scores was 95.
The total of donations reached $1,000.
The total number of guests was 20.
The storm caused a total of five outages.
She discovered a hidden cave.
He discovered the truth about the rumor.
Scientists discovered a new species.
They discovered a great café downtown.
The study discovered key insights.
The fast car sped by us.
She has a fast mind for solving puzzles.
The knot was fast and wouldn’t budge.
The fast pace of the city was exciting.
This is a fast computer for gaming.
The statue stands on a stone base.
Her argument had a strong base in facts.
The army set up a base in the desert.
The soup has a tomato base.

back_cards.definition_en: a point in a game like baseball
back_cards.example_en: He stole second base in the game.
We walked in the direction of the park.
The teacher gave clear direction for the project.
The company is moving in a new direction.
Under her direction, the team succeeded.
The window faces the northern direction.

back_cards.definition_en: the first day of the week
back_cards.example_en: We go to church every Sunday.

back_cards.definition_en: a day of rest or leisure
back_cards.example_en: Sunday is perfect for relaxing at home.
The Sunday market is always busy.
They planned a picnic for Sunday.
The game is scheduled for next Sunday.
He maintains his car regularly.
She maintains a healthy diet.
They maintain their innocence in the case.
He maintains his family with two jobs.
She maintains that she was right.
The past taught us valuable lessons.
His past includes many adventures.
She often reflects on her past.
The past is behind us now.
The museum displays artifacts from the past.

back_cards.definition_en: more than half of a group
back_cards.example_en: The majority of voters supported her.
The majority of the team agreed.

back_cards.definition_en: a winning portion in an election
back_cards.example_en: He won by a clear majority.
The majority of the budget was spent.
The majority rules in this decision.

back_cards.definition_en: a state of calm or quiet
back_cards.example_en: She found peace in the quiet forest.
The treaty brought peace to the region.
There’s peace in our family now.
Meditation helps her find inner peace.
We enjoyed the peace of the countryside.

back_cards.definition_en: the main meal of the day
back_cards.example_en: We’re having pasta for dinner.
The dinner was held to honor the guests.
She hosted a dinner for her friends.

back_cards.definition_en: a meal at a specific time
back_cards.example_en: Dinner is served at 7 p.m.
The holiday dinner was a big event.

back_cards.definition_en: a person in a romantic relationship
back_cards.example_en: He introduced his partner at the party.
She’s my partner in the new startup.
My dance partner is very talented.
The partners signed the contract.
He’s been my partner in this project.
The user logged into the system.
This app has millions of users.
The library user borrowed five books.
The user updated the software.
Social media users shared the post.

back_cards.definition_en: at a higher level or position
back_cards.example_en: The plane flew above the clouds.
Her score was above average.
He’s above me in the company hierarchy.
This task is above my skill level.
The painting hangs above the fireplace.
The bird will fly to warmer lands.
We fly to Paris next week.
Time seems to fly when I’m busy.
The flag flies high above the building.
He tried to fly from danger.
She packed her lunch in a bag.
Her new bag matches her outfit.
The cashier put the items in a bag.
He carried a small bag on the trip.
She has a bag of new ideas.
It rained, therefore we stayed inside.
She was sick, therefore she missed work.
He studied hard, therefore he passed.
The road was closed, therefore we detoured.
Costs rose, therefore prices increased.
The rich businessman bought a yacht.
The cake has a rich chocolate taste.
The region is rich in natural resources.
Her dress was a rich shade of red.
The book offers a rich history of the city.
Each individual has unique talents.
The study focused on one individual.
She’s an individual with strong opinions.

back_cards.definition_en: a unique member of a group
back_cards.example_en: Every individual contributed to the project.
The individual chose to work alone.
The exam was tough but fair.
These boots are tough enough for hiking.
She’s a tough teacher who demands effort.
He’s tough and can handle pressure.
The steak was too tough to eat.
The owner of the car parked it here.
She’s the owner of the coffee shop.
The house owner renovated the kitchen.

back_cards.definition_en: a person in charge of an animal
back_cards.example_en: The dog’s owner trained it well.
He’s an owner of the startup.
We shall meet at 8 p.m.
I shall finish this project today.

back_cards.definition_en: to state a rule or obligation
back_cards.example_en: You shall not enter without permission.
We shall support the cause fully.
Shall we go to the park?
The keys are inside the drawer.
Let’s go inside to stay warm.
The treasure was hidden inside the cave.
She has friends inside the company.
He felt happy inside during the party.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who casts a vote
back_cards.example_en: The voter chose a new mayor.
Voters lined up at the polling station.
Every voter has a say in democracy.
The voters approved the new policy.
Voters will decide on the issue tomorrow.
He used a hammer as a tool.
This software is a tool for designers.
Education is a tool for success.
The toolbox contains many useful tools.
Time management is a key tool for productivity.

back_cards.definition_en: the sixth month of the year
back_cards.example_en: Her birthday is in June.
The festival happens every June.
We’re planning a trip for June.
June is perfect for outdoor weddings.
The project deadline is next June.
The village is far from the city.
She’s far more talented than I expected.
We’ve come far since last year.
Don’t go far without your phone.
The stars seem far away at night.
It may rain this afternoon.
You may leave the room now.
May you have a wonderful birthday!
She may arrive late due to traffic.
Students may use calculators during the test.
They hiked up the mountain last weekend.
The mountain was covered in snow.
Finishing the project felt like climbing a mountain.

back_cards.definition_en: a range or group of peaks
back_cards.example_en: The Rockies are a famous mountain range.
She has a mountain of work to do.
The range was visible from the valley.
The store offers a range of products.
Her skills are within the range of expertise.
He trained at the shooting range.
The missile has a range of 500 miles.
The coach prepared the team for the game.
She hired a coach for math lessons.
The coach took us to the city.
Her career coach gave great advice.
The coach was pulled by horses.
She felt fear during the storm.
His fear of heights kept him on the ground.
There’s no fear of running out of food.
Losing her job was her biggest fear.
The dark forest filled him with fear.
